3.114
Delimitation of spousal liability 
1. If the spouses have stipulated in the marriage contract that the property acquired both before the registration of the marriage and after the marriage shall be the separate property of one and the other, they shall be liable for their obligations solely on the basis of their separate property. In such cases, the spouses are jointly and severally liable for joint obligations and obligations in the interests of the family. 
2. The spouses shall not be regarded as each other's guarantors or sureties in respect of obligations arising out of the possession, use or disposition of property which is the separate property of one and the other.
